notes.text:
spice was updated to fix four security issues.

These security issues were fixed:
- CVE-2016-2150: Guest escape using crafted primary surface parameters (bsc#982386).
- CVE-2016-0749: Heap-based buffer overflow in smartcard interaction (bsc#982385).
- CVE-2015-5260: Insufficient validation of surface_id parameter could have caused a crash (bsc#944787).
- CVE-2015-5261: Host memory access from guest using crafted images (bsc#948976).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: Heap-based buffer overflow in SPICE before 0.12.6 allows guest OS users to cause a denial of service (heap-based memory corruption and QEMU-KVM crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host via QXL commands related to the surface_id parameter.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

fixed: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP1:libspice-server1-0.12.5-4.1.x86_64
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP1:libspice-server-devel-0.12.5-4.1.x86_64

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: Heap-based buffer overflow in SPICE before 0.12.6 allows guest OS users to read and write to arbitrary memory locations on the host via guest QXL commands related to surface creation.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

fixed: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP1:libspice-server1-0.12.5-4.1.x86_64

notes.text: The smartcard interaction in SPICE allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (QEMU-KVM process crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors related to connecting to a guest VM, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

fixed: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP1:libspice-server1-0.12.5-4.1.x86_64
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP1:libspice-server-devel-0.12.5-4.1.x86_64

SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP1:libspice-server-devel-0.12.5-4.1.x86_64

notes.text: SPICE allows local guest OS users to read from or write to arbitrary host memory locations via crafted primary surface parameters, a similar issue to CVE-2015-5261.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
